intro: Ericameria crispa, commonly known as brittlestem goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its woody, branched stems and small, yellowish-green composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Ericameria crispa is often used in native plant gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
